intro: Pristimera caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean starfruit, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the family Meliaceae, which includes other flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit, which resembles a star shape, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental appeal and as a source of fruit in local markets.
